greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of sqrt(1-4x)/(1-x).
comment: Row sums of number triangle A106190. Partial sums of A002420.

For n>=1 onward, the absolute values give also the iterates of A122237, starting from 0. (A122237(0), A122237(A122237(0)), A122237(A122237(A122237(0))), ...), this stems from the fact that the sequence gives the positions of terms with binary expansion 1(10){n-1}0 in A014486 (see A080675).
formula: G.f.: 2/(1-x)/G(0), where G(k)= 1 + 1/(1 - 2*x*(2*k+1)/(2*x*(2*k+1) + (k+1)/G(k+1))); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, May 24 2013
D-finite with recurrence: a(0)=1, a(1)=-1; for n>1, a(n)=(1/n)*((5*n-6)*a(n-1)-(4*n-6)*a(n-2)). - _Tani Akinari_, Aug 25 2013
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Apr 24 2005
ext: Barry's formula made more succinct, as well as comments regarding interpretation as absolute values added by _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 14 2006.
